page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: {Types of farming}in the area are: arable,dairying,sheep and poultry. The most common{crop}is barley,but potatoes and flax are also grown. About 70% of the land is used for grazing.The farmers also cut and ferment their own silage as a fodder crop for the cattle. Sheep are raised on rough pasture and hills;mostly for their meat but some for their wool. {Animal breeds}: chief cattle are Fresians and Charolais while the sheep are mostly Suffolk and Blackface. {Markets:}animals are sent for slaughter at Belfast abattoir.The local market is held every Monday in Ballyclare.
